How do nanobodies like mNb6-tri demonstr: They retain function after aerosolization, lyophilization, and heat treatment.
They require intravenous administration for stability.
They lose activity when exposed to air.
They are unstable at room temperature.
What is a key advantage of trivalent nan: Enhanced binding affinity and neutralization potency due to avidity effects.
Ability to bind to the S2 domain exclusively.
Increased production efficiency in mammalian cells.
Reduced immunogenicity compared to monovalent constructs.
What is the primary function of the S1 d: Contains the receptor-binding domain (RBD) that interacts with the host cell receptor angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2).
Facilitates the fusion of viral and host cell membranes.
Stabilizes the Spike protein in the down state.
Binds to other epitopes on the Spike protein.
What structural feature of Nb6 allows it: Straddles the interface between two adjacent RBDs.
